page.title: 07Education in Sedlescombe
page.content:
There has been a long tradition of education in Sedlescombe dating back to 1840. The village is now served by a School opened in 1980 which caters for approximately 100 children between the ages of 5 and 11. They are organised into four classes. Some children from outlying areas go to other small rural schools.
From the age of 11 most children attend Claverham Community College in Battle, generally travelling there by special school bus.
Adult classes are held in the village for Keep Fit, Flower Arranging and Art.
